title: Viĵnānesvara’s Mitākśara, based upon the Yājňavalkya Smŗiti, distinguishes between Hindu social and religious laws. The is work was followed widely across India, but not in Bengal and Assam, which followed Jimutavāhana’s Dāyabhāga, which was a composite of all the Dharma Śāstras, including Manu Smŗiti. An informative analysis is by N.N. Bhattacharya, “Property Rights of Women in Ancient India”
